page.title: 10SERVICES AVAILABLE
page.content: Public Utilities. This sparsely populated area has mains electricity, piped water, telephones but no sewerage. Electricity. Essential on a modern dairy farm for milking, is usually supplied by overhead lines. Breakdowns can occur in snow, high winds or by swans hitting the cables. Water supply. Piped water is provided by the Bristol Waterworks Company to houses, farms & outlying milking parlours. Wells are now mostly filled and covered. Sewerage. There is no main drainage and dwellings are served by their own cesspits or septic tanks.
